parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (11240015), which is a strong indicator of electoral propaganda, as it's a mandatory identifier for campaign materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Andrei Plujar, identifying him as the only "reșițean" opening the list for the 2024 Parliamentary Elections.  This directly refers to a parliamentary candidate, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. The use of Facebook as a platform further supports this conclusion.  It addresses the population of Caraș-Severin.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's primary objective is to promote Andrei Plujar's candidacy for the parliamentary elections. Phrases like "On December 1st YOU choose who you want to be your voice for Caraș-Severin!" directly encourage voters to support him. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic content. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it focuses solely on promoting a specific candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clear campaign message aimed at influencing voters' choices in the upcoming elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1665040587725701</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Andrei Plujar), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has the clear objective of influencing voters to choose him in the parliamentary elections. The presence of the CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's timing, after the official campaign period, is also a violation of Article 98 t).  While the ad library shows the ad ran before the end of the official campaign period, the fact that it is still active after the end of the campaign period is a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Andrei Plujar</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Caraș-Severin, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1665040587725701) cu scopul de a promova candidatura lui Andrei Plujar la alegerile parlamentare, conținând elemente de propagandă electorală, inclusiv numărul CMF 11240015,  adresându-se publicului larg printr-o postare plătită pe Facebook, cu o cheltuială estimată între 1000 și 1500 RON și o estimare a numărului de impresii între 30.000 și 35.000, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului menționat.  Postarea, deși inițial difuzată în perioada campaniei electorale, continuă să fie activă după încheierea acesteia, constituind o încălcare clară a legislației.  Datele de contact ale USR Caraș-Severin sunt disponibile pe pagina lor de Facebook și includ adresa de email caras-severin.judet@usr.ro și numărul de telefon +40759017677.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
